projects.role: Frontend Engineer at Naver Financial (Oct 2024 - Present)

project1.title: Naver Financial - Corporate Employee Welfare Platform (Frontend Lead)

descriptions.0: Led the design and implementation of a scalable SPA architecture using React Router Data APIs
descriptions.1: Designed end-to-end authentication and error-handling flows between the BFF and frontend, including a custom error class–based domain exception framework
descriptions.2: Established a consistent async data-loading structure by separating route-level checks from client-side data fetching, primarily using React Query
descriptions.3: Reduced production bundle size by 30% by applying dynamic imports to eliminate unnecessary code, and improved load performance through lazy loading and gzip-compressed asset delivery via Vite configuration
descriptions.4: Built a complex form state management system using React Hook Form and Zod, including secure file signature verification
descriptions.5: Improved production monitoring reliability by configuring Vite to use hidden source maps, eliminating unnecessary source map HTTP requests from monitoring tools while maintaining accurate stack trace resolution
descriptions.6: Improved API reliability by migrating from swagger-typescript-api to Orval, introducing OpenAPI-based client generation with Zod-powered runtime response validation, reducing integration errors and increasing confidence in backend data contracts
descriptions.7: Enhanced user experience by implementing client-side timeout handling and refetch strategies during BFF delays and gateway timeout scenarios
descriptions.8: Contributed to implementing a Canary dark-release deployment strategy to replace the legacy Blue/Green process, enabling stable QA and progressive rollouts

project2.title: Naver Financial - Customer Inquiry Portal (Frontend Development, Sub Project)

descriptions.0: Built customer-facing inquiry pages with requirement-driven UI improvements, focusing on usability and clarity
descriptions.1: Improved mobile UI stability through cross-device testing and layout refinements

project3.title: Naver Financial - Internal Admin Dashboard (Frontend Development, Sub Project)

descriptions.0: Developed internal admin dashboards using React and managed complex UI state with Jotai
descriptions.1: Integrated multiple BFF and backend APIs to support core workflows and maintain clear service boundaries

descriptions.0: Built a full-stack personal blog using Next.js 15 (App Router) and Supabase for authentication, storage, and database management
descriptions.1: Handled login and post creation logic on the server using Next.js Server Actions
descriptions.2: Adopted a static-first rendering strategy with on-demand revalidation using revalidatePath to balance performance and content freshness
descriptions.3: Implemented a custom Markdown editor and renderer based on MDX
descriptions.4: Built a Tailwind CSS–based design system and improved UI details
descriptions.5: Implemented protected route handling and server-side auth verification using Next.js Middleware
descriptions.6: Enhanced login security by integrating CAPTCHA and applying Redis-based IP rate limiting to block bot and brute-force attacks
descriptions.7: Built an i18n locale management structure and improved routing by integrating it with Middleware
descriptions.8: Optimized asynchronous rendering and loading flows using Suspense to reduce UX delays
